An excellent Punjabi place in the neighborhood with delicious sweets, breakfast parontas and especially the Saag and Makki di Roti!!

We have been going here for many years and love it.
Very bad service of thali
Takes forever for ANYTHING here.

I had an amazing experience at Punjabi Dhaba on 101 Punjabi Ave! The food was bursting with authentic flavors ‚Äî from the perfectly spiced yellow Daal to the fresh, fluffy naan. The staff was warm and welcoming, making me feel right at home. The portion sizes were generous, and everything tasted freshly prepared. Definitely my go-to spot for real Punjabi comfort food!
best food in NYC

I got overcharged for spoiled food. The customer service here is so bad. I got overcharged for spoiled food because of a mistake on the shop‚Äôs end. I put in an order for a tray of malai kofta and was told the price is $55.  Told the lady who answers the phone that we will pick it up at 2pm tomorrow. We called at 12pm on a Thursday and this lady decides to go ahead and get the order ready for 2pm that same day. Like, what? When we went to pick up the order the next day, they overcharged the spoiled day old food for $65 instead of $55. So basically, they overcharged me AND gave me spoiled food so what did I pay extra $10 for? Refrigeration charges???? This is the reality of Punjabi restaurants. They don‚Äôt care at all and would blame the customers than take responsibility.
Bad service :
Very bad service.

The food at Punjabi Dhaba is really good! The dal makhni and shahi paneer were absolutely the best‚Äîfull of rich flavor and perfectly cooked. They also serve a complimentary lassi that is mind-blowing‚Äîit gives a true and amazing Indian taste!

The gulab jamuns were soft, sweet, and very delicious. The butter naan and garlic naan were soft and fresh, just right. However, the plain tandoori roti wasn‚Äôt as good‚Äîit was too thin, hard, and chewy, which made it unpleasant to eat. Also, the laddus didn‚Äôt taste great and could definitely be improved.

The chole bhature are also highly recommended. They have a subtle yet rich flavor that makes them really enjoyable and satisfying without being too heavy.

Otherwise, it‚Äôs a very nice place with great food overall!
Excellent Pani Puri. We really enjoyed our meal. Perfect on a hot day!

We were super hungry and the food was so delicious that we totally forgot to take pictures!! We ordered paneer pakode and jalebi(which were okish), chole bhature(really good), dahi poori(very tasty), salty chaach(kind of unlimited supply) and Noodle Burger (which was just AMAZING)‚Ä¶  my cousin lives in Boston asd he was so impressed with the food that he got packed 4 vegetables and 1 biryani. The quatity was super large (like almost 3 bowls in one container) while most items are priced at $12-13. Must say I have had good punjabi food after ages in New York. This is definitely my to go destination for food again‚Ä¶!!
Very Authentic customer service but makhan (homemade butter) and free butter milk made me over come it‚Ä¶ very nice delicious quality foods here
Nice foods ‚Ä¶ü•ò‚Ä¶. Attractive place
Really good food

I'm Pakistani and I had a craving for Halwa Puri but I couldn't find a place that had it so I decided to go here for chole bhature. I was not expecting too much but it was one of the best meals I've had. My husband is American and doesn't like Indian food that much but as soon as he took one bite he was in love. His favorite dish was the aloo tikki and chole bhature and the chia was amazing ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

My mom and me had multiple meals in 2days and it was worth a place to go back and have authentic Punjabi food. Food was fresh and like home made. My mom didn‚Äôt any other place in last 4 months but this one. Can‚Äôt praise enough about this small n cozy place. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. Food was amazing. If you are in this area I would recommend going to this place. Sweets were fresh and so yummy.

The food here is incredibly authentic and absolutely delicious, it truly tastes like home to me.

The Thali was spectacular. Every dish was perfectly spiced, and the cool, creamy buttermilk was the ideal way to wash it all down.

The Dahi Bhalla was a beautiful balance of tangy, spicy, and sweet, with cold, soothing dahi. It was generously topped with onions and potatoes, adding both texture and heartiness.

The Moong Dal Halwa was a standout, it wasn‚Äôt cloyingly sweet, but delicately tender and moist. It tasted divine, like it had been made with mother‚Äôs love. In fact, every dish felt like it had been prepared with genuine care and warmth.

I‚Äôve also tried the Chole Bhature and Mooli Paratha on previous visits, both are excellent and highly recommended.

This place is a hidden gem with delicious food. An Indian friend recommended it and we were the only non Indians eating there. The food was fresh and and delicious. The restaurant is super casual and you order at the counter and then they bring out your food. Service is a bit slow but worth the wait. The place wasn‚Äôt too busy on a Thursday around 7pm, but after 8pm it was a nonstop stream of customers. I highly recommend the chole bhature and aloo tikki chaat.
PRO TIP- you can pay after you are done eating, but I‚Äôd suggest just paying when you order so you can skip waiting in line again to pay at the end.

Very nice workers. Great customer service. They treat you like family here. So friendly and respectful. Food is of course 12/10!!! Amazing flavors and I will definitely be using them as my caterers for my wedding day!! Highly recommend

ordered malai chaap but got only raw chaap with oil and when called them to ask about this, the ladies replied that it is malai chaap and we do not add oil but in pictures and videos it is oil
totally fake and no good customer service
Everything is amazing. Just try it. I tried their THAALI at brunch. Masha‚ÄôAllah it was amazing like pure Lahore Dhaba ü•∞
One of my fav places to go  for religious items. The employees are always helpful and the owner is also very helpful. Found my favorite sweets.

No good service. To get one order to done they taking more than one hour still they dint serve food if people who come in hungry if you come to this place we should die hear only waiting waiting please don't come hear and waste your time and health.
Bad service worst atmosphere. I highly recommend not to go hear.

Hey proud Vegetarians! I am back with this exciting place i tried in the New York City. You should definitely try Aloo Tikki Chat. Chats are all about chutneys and they make is the right tangy, sweet and spicy. The kind lady will only charge you $6 and serve you food worth $20. I mean the quantity this Dhaba serves is huge. The taste of the food is soooo good that i bet you won‚Äôt miss India for a moment. I also tried their veg thali as you can see. It costs $8 and is super delicious made with pure butter, fresh vegetables, lot of paneer and LOVE! QUANTITY at less price, EXCEPTIONAL TASTE and LOVE is what makes this food joint special. I would definitely travel from New Jersey to New York around 40 miles to have this delicious food.

This is the most disgusting food I‚Äôve ever had in my life. The chicken vindaloo was not chicken vindaloo. I don‚Äôt know what the hell that was but it was disgusting. The chicken was all brown and dark. The rice was old and it was just a‚Ä¶

Food made us feel sick. Yogurt in chaat papdi was sour, had gone bad. Called in just to make staff aware but they denied it without even checking. Also chutneys are diluted, there is no real tamarind chutney, just sugar water with food‚Ä¶
The best punjabi food in Hicksville area. Jitender is an amazing server who recommended me to t try their Amritsari Kulche. Top notch and unbeatable. They reminded me of Puniab!

Food is decent. It is very reasonably priced however the quality is mediocre. Malai kofta was good but food is very oily and buttery. Service is definitely slow and restaurant does not appear too clean. They only have one waiter for about 9 tables.

Love that they are purely vegetarian and i don't have to worry about contamination from non-veg foods. Food is also my level of spicy and tasty. (Visited in August 2020)
Another visit, delicious as always. No complains.
An authentic Punjabi dhaba 30min drove from JFK. Very Authentic customer service but makhan (homemade butter) and free butter milk made me over come it
Chole bhatura is just amazing‚Ä¶  so good.
Very organized set up.  They had alot of options set up on tables,  possibly because of Diwali. They were very kind.  A box of 12 pieces cost about $8. The sweets were good.
A perfect food gem for the Punjabi‚Äôs visiting NYC. Good parantha and service. Lassi (buttermilk) is complimentary and don‚Äôt hesitate to try it.

Food is good
